text: I think this is a great idea. Especially if more layout decisions are made page level instead of having marketers make template changes in the design manager.
are you currently just uploading files to the file manager then copy and pasting the url into a link field?

Yeah since the `Image` column type does not show `.pdf` file extensions and that's the only column type that would open up the File Manager to select an item.
Thankfully, our client should be uploading into a single folder so it makes import/export of items a bit easier to handle. But makes thing a little more cumbersome for them to have to copy/paste a URL from a different tab/screen of the file manager instead of selecting directly within the HubDB row's column, or if for instance the File in File Manager was replaced with a new filename, they'd have to manually update the reference in that HubDB row.

When creating translations, HubSpot just clones the form that I want to translate instead of storing these translations in the same form.  Is it possible to keep the translations in the same form?  Or at least in the works?
great points and I agree it is cumbersome in this case.

Ability to develop pages locally has opened up so many possibilities. We started using LESS for faster and cleaner development. However, quickly realized we won’t be able to maintain a sync between HS console and Local since LESS won’t work on HS console. Being able to code in LESS on HS console will be awesome and would save a ton of time!
That definitely makes sense. We’ll plan on adding that--might be a little bit but it’s now officially on the list!
Why not just upload your compiled CSS?
Sometimes when team members (non developers) make CSS updates on the console then there would be inconsistency with LESS (local) and console.
